Standard Populations

Source: vignettes/standard_populations.Rmd
standard_populations.Rmd

Introduction

In this vignette, we will explore the EpiStandard functions designed to retrieve or create a standard population data table. There are two functions to help with this:

  • standardPopulation()
  • mergeAgeGroups()

Retrieve standard population data

The package contains two standard population data tables:

  • ESP2013:
  • WSP2025:
library(EpiStandard)
library(gt)

pop <- standardPopulation("esp2013")
gt(pop)
age_group pop
0 to 4 5000
5 to 9 5500
10 to 14 5500
15 to 19 5500
20 to 24 6000
25 to 29 6000
30 to 34 6500
35 to 39 7000
40 to 44 7000
45 to 49 7000
50 to 54 7000
55 to 59 6500
60 to 64 6000
65 to 69 5500
70 to 74 5000
75 to 79 4000
80 to 84 2500
85 to 89 1500
90 to 150 1000

You can create new age groups using the ‘mergeAgeGroups()’ function. This allows you to combine the age groups in the standard population.

merged_data <- mergeAgeGroups(pop, newGroups = c("0-19", "20-64", "65-150"))
gt(merged_data)
age_group pop
0-19 21500
20-64 59000
65-150 19500
